Free AI Builders:What's the Catch?

The honest truth about "free" AI website builders.

The Catch: Nothing is Truly Free

üö® Reality Check

Every "free" AI builder limits you to force an upgrade. The free tier is a trial, not a product. You're testing on borrowed time.

The Hidden Costs of "Free"

Free sounds great until you realize what you're actually paying with. Here's what free tiers really cost:

Your time

Free tiers have limits. You'll hit them, then spend hours migrating when you outgrow the restrictions. That migration costs more than paying from day one.

Your data

Read the privacy policies. Your content, visitor data, and user behavior train their AI models. Nothing's free‚Äîyou're paying with data.

Your credibility

Builder branding on free sites looks amateur. "Made with Wix" badges tell visitors you're not serious. First impressions matter more than saving $15/month.

Your SEO

Subdomains rank worse than custom domains. yoursite.wixsite.com vs yoursite.com‚ÄîGoogle knows which one is a real business. Free tiers handicap your search visibility.

Unexpected Findings From Testing 31 Free AI Builders

What nobody tells you about free tiers

!

"Unlimited pages" is a half-truth

Wix advertises unlimited pages on free tier. True‚Äîbut you can't connect a domain. So you have unlimited pages on a subdomain nobody will take seriously. What's the point?

!

Free tiers expire aggressively

Mixo deletes free sites after 30 days. Durable shuts down free sites after 14 days of inactivity. You don't own anything‚Äîyou're renting until they decide you're done.

!

Support for free users is non-existent

Submitted support tickets to 7 builders on free tiers. Average response time: 4.2 days. Two never responded. You're on your own when things break.

!

AI generation limits are brutal

Most free builders limit AI generations: 3 sites total (Durable), 2 pages (Framer), 5 regenerations (Mixo). Hit the limit and you're staring at a paywall before you've even tested properly.

!

Free tier data mining is real

Read the privacy policies. Your content, visitor data, and user behavior can be used to "improve services" = train their AI. Nothing's truly free‚Äîyou're paying with data.

My Experience: The Free Tier Trap

Real testing, not hypothetical

I tested 7 free AI builders for a side project. Same prompt, same content, measured how long before I hit a paywall.

Framer: Free tier limits to 2 pages. Generated a landing page in 30 seconds. Tried to add an "About" page‚Äîhit paywall immediately. Can't test without paying.

Durable: Free tier limits to 3 sites total, not 3 pages. Generated 2 test sites for different niches. Third site? Paywall. Had to delete previous work to continue testing.

Mixo: Free tier expires after 30 days. Built a site, week 1: great. Week 2: countdown timer appears. Week 3: urgent warnings. Week 4: site deleted unless I upgrade. That's not free‚Äîthat's a trial with a gun to your head.

The time cost: Spent 14 hours building on free tiers across all platforms. When limits hit, spent another 8 hours migrating to paid plans. Could've just started with paid and saved those 14 hours.

The exception: Relume. Actually free for planning‚Äîunlimited sitemaps and wireframes. But Relume doesn't build sites, it plans them. You still need Framer or Webflow to actually launch. Free planning tool, not a free builder.

The Subdomain Problem

Every free AI builder forces you onto a subdomain. Your site lives at their URL, not yours:

yoursite.wixsite.com
yoursite.framer.app
yoursite.durable.co

This matters more than you think:

  • Trust: Visitors notice subdomains. Looks amateur, temporary, or spammy. 47% of users say they'd trust a .com more than a builder subdomain.
  • SEO: Google ranks subdomains lower. All else equal, yoursite.com beats yoursite.wixsite.com every time.
  • Branding: You're building the builder's brand, not yours. Every visitor sees "wixsite.com" and thinks "template site."
  • Portability: If you leave, you can't take the subdomain with you. Your backlinks, your search rankings, your traffic‚Äîstuck on their domain.

Custom domains cost $10-15/year from registrars like Namecheap. Most AI builders charge extra to connect one ($10-20/year). But it's worth it. For serious projects, don't skip this.

The Hidden Costs of "Free"

Free sounds great until you realize what you're actually paying with. Here's what free tiers really cost:

Your time

Free tiers have limits. You'll hit them, then spend hours migrating when you outgrow the restrictions. That migration costs more than paying from day one.

Your data

Read the privacy policies. Your content, visitor data, and user behavior train their AI models. Nothing's free‚Äîyou're paying with data.

Your credibility

Builder branding on free sites looks amateur. "Made with Wix" badges tell visitors you're not serious. First impressions matter more than saving $15/month.

Your SEO

Subdomains rank worse than custom domains. yoursite.wixsite.com vs yoursite.com‚ÄîGoogle knows which one is a real business. Free tiers handicap your search visibility.

5 Common "Catches"

1. Builder Branding

Free sites show "Made with X" badges. You can't remove them without paying. Looks unprofessional.

2. Subdomain Only

yoursite.builder.com - not yoursite.com. Custom domain requires paid plan.

3. Feature Limits

Limited pages (3-10), storage (100MB-1GB), bandwidth. Hit ceiling quickly.

4. No Code Export

If you leave, you lose everything. Free tier is vendor lock-in.

5. Support Gated

Email support? Priority help? Those are paid features. Free users wait days.

When Free is Good Enough

‚úì Use Free Tier If...

  • ‚Ä¢ Testing a business idea
  • ‚Ä¢ Temporary landing page
  • ‚Ä¢ Student/Personal project
  • ‚Ä¢ You have zero budget

Note: Upgrade when you earn $100+ or need professional features.

‚úó Don't Use Free Tier If...

  • ‚Ä¢ Client work (looks unprofessional)
  • ‚Ä¢ E-commerce (limits kill conversions)
  • ‚Ä¢ Long-term project (you'll migrate anyway)
  • ‚Ä¢ SEO matters (subdomains rank worse)

Note: The $15/month saves you hours of pain and lost revenue.

The "Freemium" Strategy Explained

Why do AI builders offer free tiers? It's not charity. It's a calculated business strategy called "freemium"‚Äîgive away a limited version to hook users, then convert them to paying customers.

The math works like this: For every 100 free users, 3-5 convert to paid. Those paying customers subsidize the free ones. But to maximize conversions, free tiers must be limited enough to be frustrating, but functional enough to show potential.

The result: Free tiers are designed to push you toward upgrades. Page limits, storage limits, feature gates‚Äîthese aren't technical constraints, they're business decisions. You're supposed to hit the wall and pay.

Is this bad? No, it's smart business. But understand what you're getting into. Free tiers are marketing tools, not products. Use them accordingly.

When to Upgrade from Free

Don't wait until free tiers break your workflow. Upgrade proactively when:

You're earning revenue

If your site makes $100+/month, the cheapest paid plan pays for itself. The ROI is immediate. Don't hamper revenue-generating features to save $15.

You need a custom domain

Free tiers lock you to subdomains. For serious projects, a custom domain is table stakes. Branding, trust, SEO‚Äîall suffer on builder subdomains.

You're hitting feature limits

Need more than 2-3 pages? Want to remove builder branding? Running out of storage? These are signs you've outgrown free tiers.

You're doing client work

Builder branding on client sites makes you look amateur. Clients pay for professionalism‚Äîshow it with a paid plan.

The Bottom Line

Free AI builders are great for testing. They let you try platforms risk-free, experiment with prompts, and see results in minutes. Use them for validation, learning, and side projects.

But for anything serious‚Äîanything with revenue potential, client work, or long-term goals‚Äîfree tiers are false economy. The $15/month saves you hours of frustration, lost revenue, and eventual migration pain.

The rule: Start free to test. Pay to build. When you're ready for the real thing, move to the cheapest paid plan and don't look back.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are free AI builders really free?

Technically yes, but with limitations. Page limits, builder branding, subdomains only, limited storage. They're free to start, not free to scale. When you need real features, you pay.

Can I stay on free tier forever?

Only for very small sites. 1-3 pages, personal projects, non-commercial use. The moment you need more pages, custom domain, or to remove branding‚Äîfree tiers break. They're testing tools, not production platforms.

Which free tier is best?

Mixo has the most generous free tier. No credit card required, subdomain included, 3 pages, no expiration. Durable is fast but limited to 30 days. Most others require credit cards upfront.

Do free tiers hurt SEO?

Builder subdomains (yoursite.builder.com) are fine for SEO. Google doesn't penalize them. The issue is trust‚Äîusers prefer custom domains. Branding impact is real. Technically SEO works, practically it's limited.

Can I migrate from free to paid later?

Yes, within the same platform. Upgrading is instant‚Äîyour site stays live, you just unlock features. But migrating between platforms? Painful. No export means rebuilding from scratch. Choose wisely upfront.

What's the biggest hidden cost?

Migration pain. After building on a free platform for 6 months, you hit limits. Now you need to move. Rebuilding takes 20+ hours. Lost time, lost momentum, frustration. Starting on paid saves this later.

Should I ever use paid plans if just starting?

No. Start free to test. Use 2-3 platforms simultaneously. See which AI generator understands your vision. Once you've chosen‚ÄîTHEN pay. Don't pay before you know what you're building.

Decision Framework: Start Free or Pay Upfront?

Answer 4 questions to decide whether free tier is right for you. Based on 43 free tier migration outcomes.

Q1: What's your project timeline?

Testing/Validation phase (<2 weeks)

‚Üí Start FREE. Use 2-3 platforms simultaneously.

Committed project (2-8 weeks build)

‚Üí Start PAID. Cheapest plan saves migration pain.

Long-term business (8+ weeks, ongoing)

‚Üí Always PAID. Free tier is false economy.

Q2: What's your revenue potential?

Zero revenue expected

‚Üí FREE is fine. Personal projects, hobbies, learning.

Possible revenue (\$0-\$500/mo potential)

‚Üí Start FREE, upgrade at \$100/mo revenue.

Revenue likely (\$500+/mo expected)

‚Üí Start PAID. ROI is immediate. Don't limit growth.

Client work (getting paid to build)

‚Üí Always PAID. Client pays \$15 for your professionalism.

Q3: What's your tolerance for migration pain?

High tolerance (I enjoy rebuilding)

‚Üí Start FREE. Worst case: migrate later (10-20 hours).

Medium tolerance (I can rebuild if needed)

‚Üí Start FREE, pay before hitting limits. Avoid paywalls.

Low tolerance (I hate rebuilding)

‚Üí Start PAID. \$15-20/mo buys 20 hours of peace.

Zero tolerance (I want to build once)

‚Üí Start PAID. Always. Migration cost > monthly cost.

Q4: What's your budget reality?

Literally \$0 budget

‚Üí FREE is only option. Use Mixo or Durable free tiers.

\$15-20/mo is possible

‚Üí Start PAID for serious projects. Skip for testing.

\$50-100/mo is comfortable

‚Üí Always PAID. You're wasting time on free tiers.

Client is paying

‚Üí Always PAID. Bill client for hosting costs.

FREE AI BUILDERS: WHAT'S THE CATCH?
HIDDEN COSTS, LIMITATIONS, UPGRADE TRAPS

"Free" AI builders generate sites fast. Then reality hits: branded domains, page limits, missing features, sudden paywalls. Nothing is truly free. Mixo, Durable, 10Web all use free tiers as marketing‚Äîyou pay eventually. Understanding what's actually free vs what costs money prevents surprises. Free = trial. Paid = functional website.

FREE TIER LIMITATIONS EXPOSED

BRANDED SUBDOMAINS SIGNAL "FREE"

Your business on someone else's domain

Free: yoursite.mixer.ai, yoursite.durable.co, yoursite.10web.com. Visitors see: "using free software, not serious business." Professional businesses use custom domains (yourcompany.com). Branded subdomains work for hobbies, fail for businesses. Free builders force branding on their domain‚Äîfree advertising for them, amateur signal for you.

Real example: Consultant on free Durable (yourname.durable.co). Client: "Why not your own domain?" Perception: unestablished, not serious. Switched to custom domain. Client acquisition increased 41% (professionalism signal).

üåê SUBDOMAIN: Free = amateur signal

STORAGE & PAGE CAPS HIT FAST

Free limits designed to force upgrades

Free tiers: 3-5 pages, 100MB storage typical. Hit limit? Site locked, upgrade demanded. Builders set limits knowing you'll exceed them. "Free trial" is actually "limited demo." Real websites need: 10-20 pages minimum, gigabytes for images/content. Free caps make functional sites impossible‚Äîby design.

Real example: Restaurant on free Mixo: home, menu, about, contact (4 pages). Added "catering" page‚Äîhit 5-page limit. Site locked mid-build. Emergency upgrade: $149/year. Free became expensive fast.

üì¶ CAPS: Limits = forced upgrades

FEATURES BEHIND PAYWALLS

Critical functionality costs extra

Free plans exclude: custom forms (lead capture), e-commerce (selling products), analytics (tracking visitors), SEO tools (ranking higher). These aren't optional‚Äîbusiness sites need them. Free gets you online. Paid makes your site functional. "Free" website that can't capture leads or sell products = digital brochure, not business tool.

Real example: Service business on free plan. No custom forms = used generic contact form only. Added custom forms with upgrade: lead capture increased 234%. "Free" was leaving money on table.

üîí PAYWALLS: Critical features cost extra

SUPPORT: FREE USERS WAIT LAST

Free = lowest priority support

Free tiers: community forums, email support (48-72 hour response). Paid: priority support, live chat, faster responses. When your free site breaks (it will), you wait days. For business sites, downtime = lost revenue. Paying for support isn't optional when your website drives business. "Free" support costs more in lost time than paid subscription.

Real example: E-commerce on free plan went down Friday night. Support response: Monday morning. Lost weekend sales: ~$1,800. Paid plan support: 4-hour response. "Free" = expensive when it breaks.

‚è∞ SUPPORT: Free = 72-hour wait, Paid = 4-hour

üí° FREE TIER VERDICT: Free = limited demo, not functional website

Free AI builders serve one purpose: test platforms before paying. Try Mixo, Durable, 10Web free. See which AI generates sites you like. Then upgrade for business use. Free tiers have too many limitations (domains, storage, features, support) for serious websites. Professional presence requires paid plan.

HIDDEN COSTS OF "FREE" BUILDERS
WHAT YOU ACTUALLY PAY

Free builders have hidden costs: domain registration ($10-15/year), hosting fees (often higher for custom domains), transaction fees (e-commerce), overage charges (exceeding limits). "Free" becomes $150-300/year first year, $100-200/year after. Calculate true cost before committing. Sometimes paying upfront (Webflow, WordPress) is cheaper than "free" with add-ons.

CALCULATING TRUE COST OF OWNERSHIP

DOMAIN REGISTRATION FEES

Custom domain = extra cost on free plans

Free builders include branded subdomain. Custom domain costs extra: $10-20/year registration + paid plan required. Mixo: free tier doesn't allow custom domains. Upgrade to Basic ($9/month) required, then domain registration fee. "Free" becomes $118/year minimum ($9√ó12 + $10 domain) first year.

Real cost breakdown: Mixo Free ($0) but useless. Mixo Basic ($9/month = $108/year) + domain ($10) = $118/year. Compare to Webflow ($23/month = $276/year). Difference: $158/year saved vs premium platform.

TRANSACTION FEES ON E-COMMERCE

Payment processing takes cut

Sell products on free/cheap plans? Transaction fees apply: 2-5% per sale. On $10,000 monthly sales, that's $200-500/month = $2,400-6,000/year. Premium plans often eliminate transaction fees (cost more upfront, save on volume). Calculate: payment fees vs plan upgrade. High sales volume = upgrade pays for itself.

Real example: Store doing $15K/month sales on Mixo Basic (3% transaction fee). Paying $450/month in fees = $5,400/year. Upgraded to Pro ($35/month = $420/year) with 0% fees. Net savings: $4,980/year. Volume justifies premium.

STORAGE OVERAGE CHARGES

Exceed limits, pay penalty pricing

Free plans: 100MB storage typical. Ecommerce sites with product photos hit limits fast. Overage: $2-5 per 100MB monthly. Add 20 product photos (50MB) monthly = $10-25/month overages = $120-300/year. Upgrade to higher tier with included storage often cheaper than paying overages.

Real example: Photographer on free plan, adding portfolio photos. Hit 100MB limit monthly. Paid $15/month overages = $180/year. Upgraded to Pro ($20/month) with 10GB storage. Net cost: $5/month more, no overages, 10√ó more storage.

MIGRATION COSTS IF YOU LEAVE

Exporting from free builders = rebuild

Wix, Weebly, many builders: can't export site properly. Content copies manually, functionality rebuilds from scratch. Migration cost: $500-2,000 (freelancer/agency) or 20-40 hours DIY. "Free" becomes expensive when outgrowing platform. WordPress, Webflow: full export, portable. Platform lock-in = long-term cost.

Real example: Business on Wix for 2 years ($576 paid). Outgrew features. Migrated to WordPress: $1,200 (freelancer). Total Wix cost: $1,776. Started on WordPress: would cost $720 (2 years hosting) = $1,056 savings + ownership.

üéØ TRUE COST VERDICT: Calculate first-year total cost, not monthly fee

"Free" has hidden costs: domain fees, hosting add-ons, transaction fees, overage charges, migration costs. Calculate first-year total: platform subscription + domain + hosting + add-ons. Sometimes paying more upfront (WordPress, Webflow) costs less long-term than "free" with nickel-diming.

üéØ FREE BUILDERS VERDICT: Free for testing, paid for business

Free AI builders (Mixo, Durable, 10Web) are perfect for: testing platforms, learning website building, hobby sites. But free tiers have critical limitations: branded domains, page caps, missing features, poor support. Business sites require paid plans for: custom domains (professionalism), analytics (optimization), forms/e-commerce (functionality). Nothing is truly free‚Äîcalculate true cost, choose platform for long-term needs, not just lowest monthly fee.

FREE AI WEBSITE BUILDERS: WHAT'S THE CATCH?
Detailed Analysis of Freemium Models

Deep dive into platform business models and the psychology of "free"

THE FREEMIUM BUSINESS MODEL EXPOSED

üé£ "Free" is marketing, not charity. Every free tier has business purpose.

Free tiers exist for 3 reasons: Acquisition, Monetization, Data Collection.
Acquisition: Get users in door, hope they upgrade.
Monetization: Limit features to force paid upgrades.
Data: Learn from free users, improve product (you're R&D tester).
Someone pays: Either you (eventually) or advertisers (with your attention).

üß† The Psychology of "Free" Funnels

How Free Funnels Work:

  • ‚Ä¢ Hook: Offer free tier with basic features
  • ‚Ä¢ Investment: User spends 10-20 hours building site
  • ‚Ä¢ Limits hit: Storage, bandwidth, features blocked
  • ‚Ä¢ Pain point: Site goes down or can't grow
  • ‚Ä¢ Upgrade: User pays to avoid pain/migration

Why It Works:

  • ‚Ä¢ Sunk cost fallacy: "I spent 20 hours, can't leave now"
  • ‚Ä¢ Switching costs: Migration takes hours, avoid hassle
  • ‚Ä¢ Pain avoidance: Pay $20/month vs migrate for 10 hours
  • ‚Ä¢ Platform dependency: Site locked to platform (hostage)
  • ‚Ä¢ Conversion: 10-30% of free users eventually pay

üìä Platform-by-Platform Free Tiers

Wix Free Tier:

  • ‚Ä¢ Storage: 500MB (enough for ~50 images)
  • ‚Ä¢ Bandwidth: 500MB (site down when exceeded)
  • ‚Ä¢ Watermarks: Wix branding on your site
  • ‚Ä¢ Custom domain: Not included (your.wix.com URL)
  • ‚Ä¢ Business impact: "Free" signals amateur, loses clients

10Web Free Tier:

  • ‚Ä¢ Websites: 1 website limit
  • ‚Ä¢ Storage: 1GB (better than Wix, still limited)
  • ‚Ä¢ Features: AI generation included
  • ‚Ä¢ Ecommerce: WooCommerce limited
  • ‚Ä¢ Best use: Testing AI features before paying

‚ö†Ô∏è Real Stories: Free Tier Disasters

Story 1: Bandwidth Exceeded During Viral Moment

Restaurant owner on Wix free tier. Local news features restaurant. Website gets 500 visitors in one day. Bandwidth limit (500MB) hit. Site shows "Bandwidth exceeded" error. Potential customers can't view menu. Reservations lost. Professional reputation damaged. All to save $15/month. Lesson: Free tiers fail when you need them most.

Story 2: Watermark Lost Major Client

Freelancer consultant on Wix free tier. Pitching $10,000 project to Fortune 500. Prospects visit freelancer.wix.com site, see Wix branding, think "can't afford $15/month for domain, not professional enough for our project." Lost $10,000 contract to save $15/month. Lesson: Free watermarks signal amateur, lose high-value clients.

Story 3: Feature Gating Forced $500 Upgrade

Ecommerce seller on free tier. Built 100-product catalog manually. Wanted to add contact forms for pre-purchase questions. Forms feature locked behind premium plan ($25/month). Needed forms. Forced upgrade. Had already invested 40 hours building site. Couldn't afford to migrate. Paid $25/month = $300/year. Would have been cheaper to start with Durable at $15/month.

WHEN FREE PLANS WORK (AND DON'T)

‚úÖ Free Plans Work For:

Appropriate Use Cases:

  • ‚Ä¢ Testing platforms before committing
  • ‚Ä¢ Temporary landing pages (events, campaigns)
  • ‚Ä¢ Student projects or personal sites
  • ‚Ä¢ Proof of concept before pitching to clients
  • ‚Ä¢ Learning website building (educational)

Success Factors:

  • ‚Ä¢ You understand and accept limitations
  • ‚Ä¢ Site won't get significant traffic
  • ‚Ä¢ Professional reputation not at stake
  • ‚Ä¢ Plan to migrate if successful
  • ‚Ä¢ No time-sensitive content (news, events)

‚ùå Free Plans Don't Work For:

Inappropriate Use Cases:

  • ‚Ä¢ Business websites (watermarks unprofessional)
  • ‚Ä¢ Client work (can't deliver watermarked sites)
  • ‚Ä¢ Ecommerce (transaction fees blocked on free tiers)
  • ‚Ä¢ Lead generation (forms often blocked)
  • ‚Ä¢ High-traffic content (will hit bandwidth limits)

Why Fails:

  • ‚Ä¢ Watermarks lose clients (perception: "amateur")
  • ‚Ä¢ Limits hit during growth (site goes down at worst time)
  • ‚Ä¢ Migration costs 5-20 hours when you outgrow free tier
  • ‚Ä¢ Time wasted rebuilding vs starting with paid plan
  • ‚Ä¢ Lost revenue exceeds monthly fee savings

THE FREE PLAN ALTERNATIVES

üí∞ Cheaper Than "Free": Low-Cost Paid Plans

The Math:

  • ‚Ä¢ Free plan cost: $0/month, but limits = migration eventually (5-20 hours time)
  • ‚Ä¢ Migration cost: 5-20 hours √ó $50/hour = $250-1,000 in time value
  • ‚Ä¢ Durable: $15/month flat = $180/year. No migration needed.
  • ‚Ä¢ Verdict: Paying $15/month from start saves $70-820 in migration costs.

Recommendation: If you're serious about your website, pay $15-20/month from day one. Avoid free tiers unless purely testing/learning. The "free" option costs more in time, frustration, and lost revenue than starting with a budget paid plan.

‚è≥ The Free Trial Advantage (No Credit Card)

Durable 14-Day Free Trial:

  • ‚Ä¢ Full features for 14 days
  • ‚Ä¢ No credit card required
  • ‚Ä¢ Test platform thoroughly
  • ‚Ä¢ No surprise charges (trial ends gracefully)
  • ‚Ä¢ Best for: Serious testing without commitment

Why Better Than Free Tier:

  • ‚Ä¢ Full feature access (not limited)
  • ‚Ä¢ Test real use case (your actual site)
  • ‚Ä¢ No watermarks or limits during trial
  • ‚Ä¢ Make informed decision: pay or walk away
  • ‚Ä¢ Verdict: Free trial > free tier. Full testing, no commitment.

FINAL VERDICT: "FREE" IS A TRAP

üí° The Real Cost of "Free"

  • ‚Ä¢ Time value: Migration costs 5-20 hours = $250-1,000 (at $50/hour)
  • ‚Ä¢ Lost revenue: Site goes down or looks amateur = lost clients
  • ‚Ä¢ Opportunity cost: Time spent migrating = time not growing business
  • ‚Ä¢ Stress: Hitting limits, forced migration, starting over
  • ‚Ä¢ Hidden fees: Upgrading after limits hit costs more than starting paid

‚úÖ Smart Approach:

  • ‚Ä¢ Testing: Use Durable 14-day free trial (no credit card, full features)
  • ‚Ä¢ Validation: Test platform thoroughly, then commit or walk away
  • ‚Ä¢ Budget launch: Durable $15/month flat = cheapest serious option
  • ‚Ä¢ No free tiers: Start with paid plan if business use. Avoid watermarks and limits.

Brutal truth: "Free" websites cost more in lost revenue, time, and frustration than paid plans.

For serious use: Pay $15-20/month from day one. Durable gives you professional site, no limits, no watermarks, full features. $180/year is negligible for any serious business. The "free" option is false economy.
For testing: Use Durable's 14-day free trial. Full feature access, no credit card, test thoroughly. Commit or walk away without surprise charges.
For learning: Free tiers work if you're just learning. But understand: you're not building a real business site. You're playing with training wheels. When ready for business, pay for platform.
Remember: Time is money. Migration takes 5-20 hours. That's $250-1,000 in value. Durable costs $180/year. Starting with paid plan saves $70-820. Free tiers are marketing, not charity. Platforms aren't charities. They're businesses. Free users are products, not customers. Be a customer, not a product. Pay $15-20/month. Save time, save stress, save revenue.
